arm_group.description: All males ages 4 and up affected by XLHED

biospec_descr.textblock: Genetic tests will be carried out in a subset of subject in order to confirm XLHED status.

brief_summary.textblock:
The current study design incorporates two previously developed, non-invasive approaches to
      characterize the phenotype of individuals affected with XLHED.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phenotypic Properties in Individuals Affected With XLHED

detailed_description.textblock:
The current study design incorporates two previously developed, non-invasive approaches to
      characterize the phenotype of individuals affected with XLHED. Facial 3-dimensional (3D)
      imaging will be created from white-field morphometric scanning (Hammond, 2004. The 3D facial
      photographs collected from males (ages 4 years and up) will be used to develop a
      non-invasive screening tool, which could enable detection of craniofacial signs of XLHED in
      the newborn period. 3D facial profiling has been reported to be effective in identifying HED
      (Dellavia et al., 2008), but the technology does not yet meet the ease-of-use criteria for a
      universal screening tool.

      Standard 2-dimensional (2D) frontal and lateral facial photographs will be taken of the same
      XLHED-affected male subjects as well as of adult females (ages 18-45 yrs) at risk for being
      XLHED carriers and unaffected adult female controls. The 2D facial photographs will serve a
      dual purpose; the first being to beta-test a previously developed algorithm to identify
      males affected with XLHED (Automatic Phenotype Identification of XLHED Patients Final
      Report, December 25, 2012, unpublished), and the second  to adapt the facial recognition
      algorithm to identify female carriers of XLHED.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Females of original gender of age 18-45 years who are registered and attending the
             2013 NFED Family Conference.  This will include those at risk for XLHED and controls

          2. XLHED-affected males of original gender of age 4 yrs and up who are registered and
             attending the 2013 NFED Family Conference

          3. Provide informed consent/assent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Subjects who are not able or are not willing to comply with the procedures of this
             protocol

          2. Subjects with any major medical problem that will prevent them from participating in
             this study

          3. Male subjects who participated in the prior study ECP-003 sponsored by Edimer
             Pharmaceuticals Inc. in May 2011 in San Francisco, CA

          4. Males at risk for XLHED with prior genetic testing that did not reveal an EDA
             mutation

study_pop.textblock: XLHED affected males and females and unaffected female controls

clinical_study.official_title: Phenotypic Properties in Individuals Affected With X-linked Hypohidrotic Ectodermal Dysplasia: Symptoms and Facial Recognition

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: To collect demographic and clinical status information in XLHED-affected males, adult females at risk for XLHED and adult female controls using a medical questionnaire
primary_outcome.measure: To collect demographic and clinical status information in XLHED-affected males, adult females at risk for XLHED and adult female controls

primary_outcome.description: To test and refine a computer algorithm for facial recognition of XLHED based on 2D facial photographs obtained from subjects at risk for XLHED and controls
primary_outcome.measure: To test and refine a computer algorithm for facial recognition of XLHED

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate 3-dimensional facial imaging technology for mapping craniofacial development in XLHED males
primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate 3-dimensional facial imaging technology for mapping craniofacial development in XLHED males

primary_outcome.description: To test for the presence of genetic mutations in subjects at risk for XLHED who lack prior genetic diagnosis
primary_outcome.measure: To test for the presence of genetic mutations in subjects at risk for XLHED

primary_outcome.description: To test the validity of a using saliva samples for genetic testing buy simultaneously perform genetic testing on blood and salvia and comparing the mutations identified
primary_outcome.measure: To test the validity of a using saliva samples for genetic testing

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
